intro: Ptilostemon afer, commonly known as the African ptilostemon, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in dense inflorescences, and can range in color from white to pale pink. Ptilostemon afer is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
